summary: "In the Mood for Love" is a 2000 romantic drama film by Hong Kong director Wong Kar-wai. It tells the story of a man and a woman in 1962 who discover their spouses are having an affair and gradually fall in love themselves. The film stars Tony Leung and Maggie Cheung and is part of an unofficial trilogy with "Days of Being Wild" and "2046." It received critical acclaim and won several awards, including Best Actor for Leung at the Cannes Film Festival. It's considered one of the greatest films in Asian cinema.
title: In the Mood for Love
